text:
A simple page like this:

<%@page contentType="text/plain"%>

Will return a content type of text/html when served through Apache.  Going 
directly to Tomcat results in the proper content type being served.  
Apache/Tomcat will always return text/html no matter what you try to 
set the content type to.  Curiously, servlets are not affected by this bug.
creator: drees@ebetinc.com
marc.saegesser@apropos.com
text:
Works OK for me using 3.2.2b1, mod_jk, and Apache 1.3.9 on Win2000.  I'm 
leaving the report marked open so that it can be checked on other platforms but 
it won't get fixed for 3.2.2.

I'll retest with 3.2.2b1, did you use ajp12 or ajp13?  My initial bug report 
was on Linux.
creator: drees@ebetinc.com
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Closing the bug, if it can be reproduced with current versions ( ajp13, 
mod_jk12, tomcat33 ) please reopen it. It should be fixed.
